channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #055
item.description: This week is mostly obscured by the disappearance of Jim Weirich, and his last commit comments flow is a small sign of his impact in the ruby community.
item.content:encoded:
#055 - feb 23th 2014

Edito

This week is mostly obscured by the disappearance of Jim Weirich, and his last commit comments flow is a small sign of his impact in the ruby community.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Parrot AR Drone
Hacky toy.
Wallbase
A repository of wallpapers with a neat UI.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Style Guide
A community effort to list commonly considered best practices in ruby coding.
North
Design and development standards to align and guide your project.
Nota
Visual feedback and issue tracking for web apps.
REPL
json manipulator in javascript.
Random User
Like Lorem Ipsum, but for people.
Silk
Platform for sharing collections and vizualisations about anything.
SCM Knowledge base
Software Configuration Management, Infrastructure Orchestration and DevOps.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1.0 rc1
Check the rails 4.1 new features. The final release is going to come soon.
Upgrade all your Rails
3 different security upgrades require a quick upgrade all your rails.
Psdiff
A psd previewer for git.
Cequel
A Cassandra ORM for ruby.
Baseimage docker
The minimal image from phusion for docker.
Inch
A documentation tool for the Ruby programming language.
Massren
Easily rename multiple files using your text editor.
Mina
A deployment tool, alternative to capistrano.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Complaint-Driven Development feb 18
Details on the process of development of discourse.
Infinite Scrolling in Rails: The Basics feb 19
Using pagination and ajax for making scrolling infinite (kinda).
Easy full-text search with PostgreSQL and Rails feb 19
Use the gem pg_search to add a full-text search capability to a basic rails application.
Controlling Indirect Inputs feb 19
Indirect inputs in Ruby and how they relate to you as a tester of Ruby software.
Public Methods != Public API feb 19
Some reasons why public API need a special attention.
Building and documenting API in Rails feb 19
An illustration on how to manage a rails API.
Sharing Podcasts feb 20
How we can use technology to save podcasting!
5 Reasons Why You're Not Writing Tests feb 20
Some hints about how to lower the barrier for testing.
Making Accessible Links feb 20
A list of tips to improve accessibility, focused on links.
Inside DuckDuckGo, Google's Tiniest, Fiercest Competitor feb 20
How could DuckDuckGo, a tiny, Philadelphia-based startup, go up against Google?
The Why and How of Ansible and Docker feb 21
A pretty nice combination. When will we have an ansible in ruby ?

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
ES6 - The Awesome Parts (35m) feb 13
Presentation of features in the next javascript.
SassConf videos (15 videos) feb 16
Presentation of features in the next javascript.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
GitMinutes #27 (1h21) feb 17
Stefan Saasen from Atlassian.
Giant robots #86 (22m) feb 17
Humility and Patience (Peter Reinhardt of segment.io)
Ruby5 441 (6m) feb 18
mruby, Hound CI, Activeinteraction, gails flash partials, inch, inheritable aliases, RFZ updated.
Ruby Rogues 144 (1h05) feb 19
Passion, what it is not, and what it abusively used for, as a word.
Javascript Jabber 097 (42m) feb 19
Gulp.js with Eric Schoffstall.
Devops cafe 49 (58m) feb 20
With Brandon Burton (Mozilla) to talk about his DevOps journey.
Ruby5 442 (3m) feb 21
Jim Weirich (his ukulele performance).

item.title: Green Ruby News #054
item.description: Argh the subscription form was broken last week after the layout upgrade on http://greenruby.org. It's fixed now. The v2 of the website is still cooking.
item.content:encoded:
#054 - feb 16th 2014

Edito

Argh the subscription form was broken last week after the layout upgrade on http://greenruby.org. It's fixed now. The v2 of the website is still cooking.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Ruby Heroes
Vote for your ruby Hero.
57 maps to see the world
A serie of odd, funny or revealing maps of the world.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Keybase
A public directory of publicly auditable public keys. In beta.
Hemingway
Helps you write simpler english.
Sublimall
Sync sublimetext config across platforms.
Still maintained
A place to mark your open source project as abandoned or looking for a new maintainer.
Orats
Opinionated rails application templates and chef cookbooks.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Elasticsearch 1.0.0
That's a big number for that search engine tool.
Inch
A documentation tool for the Ruby programming language.
Git sh
A dedicated shell just for your Git commands.
Git commit msg
Sublimetext plugin to show the git commit history for one or more lines of code.
Forceps
Copy active record models from remote databases.
Mercury
A full featured HTML5 editor as a rails engine.
InstantClick
A js trick to begin preloading pages on hover.
Aptly
Swiss army knife for Debian repository management, for mirroring and snapshooting.
Blockade
A docker utility for testing network failures. Like putting a chaos monkey in a cage.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Using Test Doubles in ChefSpec feb 8
How to use stubs and test doubles when testing Chef cookbooks.
JavaScript Promises in Wicked Detail feb 9
All you need to know about promises.
Use An Ask, Donâ€™t Tell Policy With Ruby feb 10
An example from Pat about the ask-dont-tell pattern.
Rails 4 Engines feb 11
Split your app in many apps with engines.
Why Ruby blocks exist feb 12
Demonstration of usage of ruby blocks.
Is npm worth $2.6MM? feb 12
Interesting opinion of Steve Klabnik about the recent npm fundraising.
Upgrading Your Mind to Rails 4 feb 13
Sharing of an experience jumping to rails 4.
Putting Ruby on Rails on a diet feb 14
The bloat is not a fatality, here is how to cut the fat.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Phoenix web framework for Elixir (40m) feb 4
Presentation about the Elixir Web Framework.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #85 (40m) feb 10
I Want These Ideas To Be Free (Max Temkin).
Arreted devops 6 (1h09) feb 10
DevOps Mythbusters.
Ruby5 439 (7m) feb 11
Structuring sinatra, activerestclient, env!, foreman, nooseX, rubyheroes.
Ruby Rogues 143 (44m) feb 12
Passenger Enterprise with Tinco Andringa and Hongli Lai.
Ruby5 440 (5m) feb 14
Postgresql, gitsh, ask ruby, activity feed, facets.
Javascript Jabber 096 (45m) feb 14
The Challenges of Large Single Page JavaScript Applications with Bart Wood.

item.title: Green Ruby News #053
item.description: Here is the first edition of the Year of the Horse. As previously announced the website is going under a big rewriting which only impacts the design for now, but there is some angularization preparing behind the scene. In the while, go fix your libyaml.
item.content:encoded:
#053 - feb 9nd 2014

Edito

Here is the first edition of the Year of the Horse. As previously announced the website is going under a big rewriting which only impacts the design for now, but there is some angularization preparing behind the scene. In the while, go fix your libyaml.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Github octoverse
Graphical review of 2013 at github.
Devart
Art made with code on github, calling for coders.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Shortcutfoo
Start shortcut drills for vim, st, emacs, etc ...
Amon
Site monitoring platform including metrics and alerts.
Regexlib
This is a pretty old website, it has regexps for all your needs.
Facets
Scan Gemfile.lock for vulnerabilities.
Codebox
Another cloud IDE as a service.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Instance
Slick Object Instance API.
Oboe.js
Streaming JSON loading for Node and browsers.
Goaccess
Real-time web log analyzer and interactive viewer that runs in a terminal.
Vue.js
MVVM library for building interactive web interfaces.
Backtick
A chrome extnsion for quick access to bookmarklets.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Git tips from the trenches feb 1
A very neat collection of tricks for git.
Docker 0.8 works on OSX feb 4
Focus on Quality, new builder instructions, a new BTRFS driver, and official support for Mac OSX.
Angular + Rails with no fuss feb 4
how to add angular to your rails application, and how to setup Karma and Jasmine for testing it.
PostgreSQL awesomeness for Rails developers feb 4
Some basics that all Ruby on Rails developers who use PostgeSQL should know about.
37signals becomes basecamp feb 5
After chef and docker, now basecamp also merges the product and the company names.
Drone and Docker, Open Source CI feb 5
Continuous integration server with docker and a nice UI.
Ruby, You Autocomplete Me feb 5
Tricks to improve autocompletion in irb.
Deprecated Stuff in Ruby 2.1 feb 6
A new tool from Thoughtbot for managing dotfiles.
rcm, an rc file manager feb 6
A new tool from Thoughtbot for managing dotfiles.
Taking advantage of sessions in Vim feb 6
Presentation of vim-startify plugin.
Ruby libyaml vulnerability CVE-2013-6393 feb 6
Ruby CVE-2013-6393 aka "you are probably vulnerable", check your libxml version to remove yourself from the vulnerability.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Ruby Hangout (1h17) feb 5
Ruby Hangout with David Bock.
Ruby and Go (32m) feb 3
Rocky Mountain Ruby 2013 Ruby and Go by Lional Barrow.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #84 (46m) feb 3
With Harper Reed, former CTO of Threadless, former CTO of Obama for America, and currently CEO of Modest.
Ruby5 437 (5m) feb 4
token auth, recommundle, git pretty accept, pstore, practicing ruby, railsbricks 2.
Ruby Rogues 142 (1h21) feb 5
Depression and Mental Illness with Greg Baugues (non-technical session).
Ruby5 438 (5m) feb 7
recursion, 7 lines, token auth, deprectated stuff, worst practices.
Devops cafe 47 (54m) feb 7
Preparing the DevOps track at the upcoming QCon London 2014.
Javascript Jabber 095 (50m) feb 7
AngularUI with Dean Sofer.

item.title: Green Ruby News #052
item.description: This is the one-year last edition. For the occasion I revived the publications 001 to 012 from my archives. They are now available on the website. I was sortof surprised that some links are still very valuable. And if all goes well the new website will be ready next week.
item.content:encoded:
#052 - feb 2nd 2014

Edito

This is the one-year last edition. For the occasion I revived the publications 001 to 012 from my archives. They are now available on the website. I was sortof surprised that some links are still very valuable. And if all goes well the new website will be ready next week.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Built with chrome
A world remade with lego.
Vote for the Net awards
Vote closing in 50 days.
Oimo
A 3D physics engine in js, demo is very fast.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Layervault
Like github, but for designers.
Vim Weekly
A new weekly newsletter delivering vim tips.
You might not need jQuery
List of pure js alternatives to jquery snippets.
Practicing Ruby
This publication just open sourced its archives.
tlk.io
A simple and free webchat.
Vizify
Build a public personal resume.
LearnGitBranching
An interactive tutorial to learn more about git branching.
Great Code Club
A private developers community with monthly projects.
Javascript OO
A repository of various JS libs.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Coffeescript 1.7.1
Released on jan 28, here is what changed.
fit.js
To male things fit into other things.
Scroll Reveal
Declarative on-scroll reveal animations.
Sparkr
Lets you create ASCII sparklines for your Ruby CLIs â–â–‚â–ƒâ–…â–‡

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Culling ActiveRecord Callbacks jan 27
Save future you some time and effort and use a Service Object instead.
10 Things We Forgot to Monitor jan 29
A small list of things the monitor at bitly after feeling the pain of missing them.
Ruby 2.1: Out-of-Band GC jan 29
A patch to make Ruby 2.1's great garbage collection greater.
Docker, Jenkins, Ruby on Rails jan 29
A recipe for continuous deployment.
Bootstrap 3.1 jan 30
Details of features in that new release (official SASS suport, finaly!).
Sass: Mixin or Placeholder? jan 30
Understand the difference between including a mixin and extending a placeholder.
Elasticsearch: Indexing SQL databases. The easy way. jan 30
How to get contents from a SQL database into Elasticsearch with rivers.
Passenger now supports the new Ruby 2.1 Out-Of-Band GC jan 31
It's optional and tricky to enable, but graphs seem to prove it deserves the effort.
What are you doing for Open Data Day 2014? jan 31
Feb 22 is the open data day. Here is how you can join in.
Replacing Google Image Charts with D3.js jan 31
Example code for making your own charts and evade one more google addiction.
Onboarding developers to your Rails app sucks jan 31
Some tricks about how to make onboarding easier.
Evolution of Cookbook Development feb 1
Summarises a bunch of the current best practices for writing Chef cookbooks.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
A 6 Minute Guide to Keyword Arguments in Ruby 2.0 (7m) jan 27
Short video from cooperpress.
DOFD Episode 12: Mina for Deployment Part 1 (12m) jan 28
Mina the alternative to Capistrano, not a java http server.
Garden City Ruby 2014 (17 presentations) jan 29
Whole collection of Garden City Rubyconf from early in january.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
NodeUp 59 (1h24) jan 28
About Node new project lead.
Ruby5 435 (5m) jan 28
Lite config, Thor, Rubygems tips, Mina, Vim weekly.
Ruby Rogues 141 (1h40) jan 29
Teaching Kids with Ron Evans.
Arrested Devops 5 (51m) jan 29
Continuous Integration â€“ CI Told You So!
Ruby5 436 (5m) jan 31
Elixir fountain, Argus, STI+Hstore, Rails validators, Sparkr, Handcooler.
Javascript Jabber 094 (43m) jan 31
BonsaiJS with Tobi Reiss.

item.title: Green Ruby News #051
item.description: Next week it's chinese new year here in Taipei. During that holiday, I plan to secretly work on a dynamic version of Green Ruby website where we can filter and search links by tags or title. There may also be some redesign involved. But shht, it's secret and not even sure it will pan out.
item.content:encoded:
#051 - jan 26th 2014

Edito

Next week it's chinese new year here in Taipei. During that holiday, I plan to secretly work on a dynamic version of Green Ruby website where we can filter and search links by tags or title. There may also be some redesign involved. But shht, it's secret and not even sure it will pan out.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor, mickey, ilake - the informers
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
In flight
One century of air travel on the world map.
Fake Signs
Fake London underground signs. Simply hillarious.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Conferences
Updated list on upcoming ruby conferences.
Built with
Find out the technology behind websites.
Web apprentice
Clear and Concise Tutorials on Web Services, APIs, Libraries and Widgets.
Raw Github
Render HTML, apply CSS, execute JavaScript.
Signature Generator
For generating html signatures in your emails.
Ascii Design
A wysiwyg ascii interface design tool.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
ElasticSearch Rails
Since Tire Retired we were waiting for the official elasticsearch rails toolkit. Here is its pre-release version.
Eye
Process monitoring tool. Inspired from Bluepill and God.
Jently
A Ruby app that makes your Jenkins run tests on Github PR and updates their commit status.
Remote.js
Remote control for Web apps (using sound).
Node for IOS
Node.app is a low-footprint, Node.js-compatible JavaScript API for your mobile apps.
Rest Superman
Fast Parallel Async HTTP client as a Service to monitor and manage 10,000 web servers (java).
fn.js
A JS library built to encourage a functional programming style & strategy.
Generator angular martini
Yeoman generator for AngularJS + Go + Martini.
Ubersicht
A dashboard for recent activity on all of a user's or github organisation.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Getting started with gulp jan 19
Step aside Grunt, thereâ€™s a new task runner in town.
Replace Rake with Thor jan 20
Because unit testing Rake tasks is a pain in the ass.
51 Startup Failure Post-Mortems jan 20
An interesting list of quote about why it failed for them.
Docker raises $15M jan 21
Seems like docker is going to be even bigger this year.
Web-flow editing from Pull Requests jan 21
Github make PR easier to edit on your browser.
We spent a week making Trello boards load extremely fast jan 22
Here is how they did it (from 7s to less than 1s).
Stuff The Internet Says On Scalability jan 24
A serie of links about scalability.
Persisting data in Ruby with PStore jan 25
A simple yet powerful way to store data on the filesystem.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
ng-conf 2014 (29 videos) jan 20
The angluar conf that happened last week.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
NodeUp 58 (1h26) jan 20
Discussions around Groupon.
Ruby Rogues 140 (1h12) jan 22
Heroku with Richard Schneeman.
Devops Cafe 46 (50m) jan 23
Ben Golub, CEO of Docker, for a chat about ... Docker.
Javascript Jabber 093 (54m) jan 24
The New York Times and JavaScript with Eitan Konigsburg, Alastair Coote and Reed Emmons.
Ruby5 434 (5m) jan 24
Selecta, gowroker, devdocs, interview questions, rubyconferences.org, phantomjs.

item.title: Green Ruby News #050
item.description: In 2 weeks there is the 5th geeklist world-wide hackacthon, maybe you are interested in joining and/or suggesting projects, that can be fun.
item.content:encoded:
#050 - jan 19th 2014

Edito

In 2 weeks there is the 5th geeklist world-wide hackacthon, maybe you are interested in joining and/or suggesting projects, that can be fun.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Sony
A nice scrollbased Sony presentation all in HTML.
Black Brick Road
An (work in progress) interactive story in HTML5, code source is on github.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Kimono
Never write a web scraper again.
Nasty Icons
A perverted icon collection.
Funded
Rapid startup prototyping and financial planning.
JS the right way
Compilation of best practices for js coding, with links to sources.
GoCasts
Bite sized screencasts to help you learn Go faster.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Polymer boilerplate
A Polymer.js template for building fast, robust web apps using Web Components.
Rails Bricks
Create Rails apps faster by automating setup tasks.
Hub
Command-line wrapper for git that makes you better at GitHub.
Que
Queue for Ruby and PostgreSQL that manages jobs using advisory locks.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Ruby 1.9.3 will die in feb 2015 jan 10
Let's push towards ruby 2 harder.
Introduction to Go (Golang), Part 1 jan 12
A pretty good overview for wannabe go beginners.
Callbacks, Promises, Signals and Events jan 12
When and how use each pattern.
GitHub's Public Speaking Culture jan 13
Benefits of sending devs talk at conferences.
PolymorphicFinder jan 13
Replace conditionnals with some polymorphism, example.
Myth Busting: CSS Animations vs. JavaScript jan 13
Why CSS animation is not necessarily faster (but check this response).
Rails Testing Antipatterns: Fixtures and Factories jan 14
Some common antipatterns in writing tests for Rails applications.
Compare Commits Between Git Branches jan 16
The usage of git show-branch.
Dotenv for multiple environments jan 17
Advanced configless strategy.
Paths aren't strings jan 18
The right use of the Pathname object.
Ruby syntax trivia jan 18
Some acrobatic tricks in ruby syntax.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
What is in store for the future of Angular (54m) jan 10
Talk of angular code devs at devoxx 2013.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Food fight show jan 10 (1h031) jan 10
We're Doing It Wrong.
Arrested Devops 004 (1h01) jan 13
Agile and DevOps.
NodeUp 57 (1h21) jan 13
Discussions around Docker.
Ruby5 432 (6m) jan 14
lt-ruby, TDrails, CodeBrag, DBeater, I18nema, 1.9.3 EOL.
Ruby Rogues 139 (1h12) jan 17
Riak with Sean Cribbs and Bryce Kerley.
Javascript Jabber 092 (1h04) jan 17
The MEAN Stack with Ward Bell and Valeri Karpov.
Ruby5 433 (6m) jan 17
Activesupport notification, railsbricks, composable matchers, DotEnv, Polymorphic finder.

item.title: Green Ruby News #049
item.description: As we are approaching the first year of publication of this newsletter, it's time to think about the birthday party. It should happen in Taipei, Taiwan, after chinese new year. If you want to join, or know a good place where we could gather, feel free to drop me a mail.
item.content:encoded:
#049 - jan 12th 2014

Edito

As we are approaching the first year of publication of this newsletter, it's time to think about the birthday party. It should happen in Taipei, Taiwan, after chinese new year. If you want to join, or know a good place where we could gather, feel free to drop me a mail.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Top pens of 2013
The 100 most popular codepens of past year.
Tumble
A simple physics simulation and relaxation experiment.
Source code in Movies
Images of the computer code appearing in TV and films and what they really are.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
How is my SSL
Website that tells you how secure your TLS client is.
Webydo
Website creation tool with no coding.
Songs of github
Generate a music based on github contributions.
Vim cheat sheet
Graphical vi-vim Cheat Sheet and Tutorial.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Light Table
Recently opensourced, this IDE in clojurescript seems t deserve a try.
Alpaca
Given a web API, Generate client libraries in node, php, python, ruby.
Koa
A new framework building Node.js apps.
Magnifier.js
Javascript library enabling magnifying glass effect on an images.
Conzole
Conzole is a debug panel for a better javascript console.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Reading Rails - Concern jan 6
Composing modules using concerns in rails.
Nokogiri as a command-line tool jan 6
Use Nokogiri as a standalone script from the command line.
Hammerspace: Persistent, Concurrent, Off-heap Storage jan 7
This is how Airbnb improved prefs on translation loading.
A CRUD JavaScript Class jan 7
A very simple CRUD javascript class implementation.
Using Docker To Run Ruby Rspec CI In Jenkins jan 8
Step-by-step introduction to continuous integration testing with Docker.
Awful app-review trend among Turkish users jan 8
Flaws of the star system.
When Is It Time to Refactor? jan 9
Four Simple Guidelines to Help Get It Right.
Simple Git workflow is simple jan 9
A basic basic branching workflow for continuous delivery from Atlassians.
Github New Deployments API jan 9
Deployments are a new thing in GitHub. No UI yet, but API is previewable.
Handling Associations on Null Objects jan 10
Another story about the Null object pattern, using a feature of rails4.
Fast interactive prototyping jan 10
Using Sketch and d3.js for design prototypes.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Ember Fest 2013 - Munich (8 videos)
The videos of the conference.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Ruby5 430 (5m) jan 7
TDD JSON API, Jubilee, Exception cause, Hulse, cachig an API.
Javascript Jabber 091 (57m) jan 10
JSON APIs.
Ruby5 431 (6m) jan 10
Github Traffic, Accesslint, Hammerspace, Sneakers, Enumerators.
The Changelog 116 (1h04) jan 11
Node Black Friday at Walmart with Eran Hammer.

item.title: Green Ruby News #048
item.description: Okay there is a new year digit, let's get back to work now. And btw feel free to visit us on #greenruby on freenode.
item.content:encoded:
#048 - jan 5th 2014

Edito

Okay there is a new year digit, let's get back to work now. And btw feel free to visit us on #greenruby on freenode.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Flat design vs Realism
The battle of 2013 (actually a happy new year website from Intacto).

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
List Of D3.js libraries
about 25+ different JavaScript libraries related to D3.js.
Passweird
Generate passwords too gross to steal.
UI Faces
This tool was born from the daily toil of finding sample avatars for UI mockups.
Bootstrap Zero
Free start templates and designs for Boostrap CSS.
Blacktie
Another place for finding free bootstrap themes.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Passenger 4.0.33
Various fixes, and notably the new restart-app function.
Recap
Simpler and faster capistrano deployment.
Divergence
A HTTP proxy that lets you map subdomains to git branches for site testing.
Sneakers
Performance background processing for Ruby (picture a sidekiq on rabbitmq).
Polybox
A docker based polyglot hacker's sandbox.
Fluidbox
A replica of lightbox like they do it on Medium.
Docker Osx
Fast and easy installation of Docker on OS X.
Fig
A combination of vagrant and docker, with yaml config files.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Clean Architecture dec 27
Rails app structure following the clean principles of uncle bob, kinda.
Reading Rails - More Migrations dec 31
How Rails look up for migrations.
A Taste of Logic Programming In Ruby jan 1
Unific, Ambit, Rulog, various approach for ruby logic programming.
Rendering Collections in Rails jan 1
The use of partials to break down complex view into more manageable chunks.
5 technologies to look forward to in 2014 jan 1
Short list: asm.js, paralleljs, ES6, web components, CSS grid layout.
A Look at Ruby 2.1 jan 2
Detailled review of new features in ruby 2.1.
Javascript Module Design Pattern jan 2
Modules in js, and advantages of the revealing module pattern.
Gulp is the new black jan 3
Gulp is an alternative to Grunt.
The top 10 free UI kits for web designers jan 3
A list of CSS frameworks for designers.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
How to Prototype and Test Any Product in 5 Days (58m) jan 3
Explanation of the 5-days design sprint technique.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
RubyRogues 138 (37m) dec 31
The RubyRep Holiday Takeover (recording from the rogues retreat).
Arrested Devops 003 (56m) jan 2
This episode is called the dev show, an introspection session.
Ruby5 429 (5m) jan 3
ruby compiler, omega, rubygems, debug http clients, detect similar images, lotus.
Javascript Jabber 090 (39m) jan 3
Users Groups.

item.title: Green Ruby News #047
item.description: This week podcasters are in holidays, but ruby is not, here is v2.1 coming out. And various other notable releases visibly wanted to get out before 2014. All good for us :) See you next year!
item.content:encoded:
#047 - dec 29th 2013

Edito

This week podcasters are in holidays, but ruby is not, here is v2.1 coming out. And various other notable releases visibly wanted to get out before 2014. All good for us :) See you next year!

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
RSQ helping you sell shit since 1977
Very nice advertisement agency website.
Christmas tree
... with 11 lines of javascript.
Postcard designer
Little website to draw a symetrical shape, should amuze your kids.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Is ruby fast yet?
Practical, comparative benchmarks of Ruby implementations.
Ruby docs
Create your perfect set of docs by picking exactly the versions you need.
nth-test
A quick tester for nth-child css pseudo class.
The best design tools
A list of tools for designers.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1
The first ruby version following semantic versionning. Well it was fast.
Rubygems 2.2.0
Check the list of changes, now gems can be shared between various ruby version, ohoh.
Jasmine 2.0
This new version don't depend ruby anymore, which is replaced by node and grunt.
Ruboto 1.0
A stabilized version of this jruby android development toolkit.
Scriptexecutor
Ruby library for executing shell scripts, locally or on remote server.
Ruby object mapper
The new version of datamapper for ruby.
Unison.js
Unifying named breakpoints across CSS, JS, and HTML.
cheet.js
Easy easter eggs in the browser.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
9 common mistakes developers make dec 24
It's more about startup developers but the list of advices can make sense.
Advanced Image Optimization Tricks dec 24
Manual optimization of images, a serie of tricks.
Exception causes in ruby 2.1 dec 25
A new feature in ruby to handle nested exceptions.
The Yeoman Monthly Digest #2 dec 26
Various links related to yeoman and grunt in a very nice newsletter.
How Asset Precompile Works, Part II dec 26
This article contains some in-depth coverage of the Rails asset pipeline.
Coding With Koding dec 27
Koding just came out of private beta, here is a quick tour.
Code to Read When Learning Go dec 27
A quick post listing interesting projects in go.
How can Rails react to the rise of the JavaScript applications? dec 28
Some thought about the future of rails.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Automated CSS Testing (42m) dec 25
A talk at jsconf asia 2013.
Running Cloud Foundry on OpenStack (43m) dec 26
Dr Nic talks about making your own cloud up there.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots 80 (28m) dec 23
with Josh Pigford about time management, entrepreneurship and farming.
RubyRogues 137 (58m) dec 25
Book Club â€“ Functional Programming for the Object-Oriented Programmer with Brian Marick.
Javascript Jabber 089 (52m) dec 27
The Node Security Project with Adam Baldwin.

item.title: Green Ruby News #046
item.description: Now there are 100 subscribers to this newsletter, from 28 different countries. Nothing compared to the other publishers out there, but I have no time and interest in promotion. After all this weekly mail was just intended to be sent to a dozen of friends. And it went on like a personal habit, forcing me to keep in touch with the flow. Anyways, if I don't know you and if you like it, I'm happy enough. (and xenor is too). Happy hollidays if you get any!
item.content:encoded:
#046 - dec 22th 2013

Edito

Now there are 100 subscribers to this newsletter, from 28 different countries. Nothing compared to the other publishers out there, but I have no time and interest in promotion. After all this weekly mail was just intended to be sent to a dozen of friends. And it went on like a personal habit, forcing me to keep in touch with the flow. Anyways, if I don't know you and if you like it, I'm happy enough. (and xenor is too). Happy hollidays if you get any!

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Metaballs
Another amazing 3d demo with three.js.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rails-assets
A proxy service between bundler and bower.
ScraperWiki
It's out there in beta for a while and they prepare a release for next month.
Marvelapp
Looks like the future of mockups.
The Sprite Generator
Make sprites animation easily, by uploading image-per-image files there (or just get the code and roll your own).
Regex Golf
A coding game for regexper.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1 beta
This is the christmas gift from rails, beta, but promising.
Myth
Collection of polyfills converters for modern CSS authoring.
Prawn
After 2 years of lag, finaly the PDF generation library for ruby wakes up.
Project Hub
An HTML template for project timelines, explained.
Spinkit
CSS spiners.
Benchmarkjs
A robust benchmarking library that works on nearly all JavaScript platforms.
Gitdown
Don't commit when you're drunk (powered by arduino).
Gitless
A version control tool build on top of git.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Security Maintenance Extension of Ruby 1.8.7 and 1.9.2 dec 17
Ruby 1.8 gets back from the dead! Thx Heroku.
Another Post About Dependency Injection in Ruby dec 17
Ruby dependency injection, demystified.
5 architecture anti-patterns and solutions for large Rails apps dec 18
Lessons learned from growing a large rails app.
Happy 17th Birthday CSS dec 18
An occasion to learn or remember about the origins of CSS.
Coding in the Cloud dec 19
Dev stack for in-browser coding, featuring Cloud9 and Nitrous.
Why Usability Testing is Vital to Success dec 19
Introduction to usability and some tools that can be used to test it.
Intro to Shadow DOM dec 20
Some light shed on this part of the web components spec.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
The Padrino Framework (31m) dec 19
Padrino is a framework built on top of Sinatra.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Arrested DevOps 002 (1h06) dec 16
Does Testing Keep You From Making a Huge Mistake?
Giant robots 79 (38m) dec 16
Uncle Bob Martin about functional programming, ethics, and writing.
Ruby5 427 (5m) dec 17
rails-assets, rails database info, callbacks extraction, shutterbug, enumerable, prawn.
RubyRogues 136 (51m) dec 18
Consulting vs Product Work Part 2 with Steven Proctor.
The Changelog 115 (43m) dec 20
Flynn updates with Jonathan Rudenberg and Jeff Lindsay.
Ruby5 428 (6m) dec 20
rails 4.1beta, secrets.yml, ruby DI, yield or enumerate, dashing-rails.
Javascript Jabber 088 (46m) dec 20
Lazy.js with Daniel Tao.
